channel.title: Drunk under age?
channel.description:
Drunk before you are 16 or 21?
Is it RIGHT TO DO or A GOOD IDEA for someone younger than 16 to be drunk?
I've done it (The hang over is shit!)
DEBATE NOW.

item.title: Drunk under age?
item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:
@Monkey_wacko wrote:

Well I’m not a jock and I’m really popular… I drink (Drunk maybe 4-5 times a year besides that i don’t really drink…) but do not smoke and I’m not a looser.

Read full topic

item.title: Drunk under age?
item.dc:creator: @Fr33b1e Fr33b1e
item.description:
@Fr33b1e wrote:

Most of the popular guys are jocks. Most jocks, stereotyping them for a second, are stupid. I can prove that all of them are at my school, and they do nothing but drink and smoke. Our football team sucks ass because of them. You do get fucked over later in life, everyone does. Usually happens to jocks before the “losers”.

Read full topic

not really. the whole idea of being popular is that you don’tg get fucked over.

item.title: Drunk under age?
item.dc:creator: @Fr33b1e Fr33b1e
item.description:
@Fr33b1e wrote:

Well, from what some of my friends tell me, even though I hardly listen to them, emo’s cut themselves mostly, because it takes away all the emotional pain that’s been caused. I am also not an attention whore, I could care less if I was the most popular guy ever. I’d rather be a loser, than the popular guy. What happens to the popular guy 99% of the time? He gets fucked over somehow.

item.title: Drunk under age?
item.dc:creator: @Fr33b1e Fr33b1e
item.description:
@Fr33b1e wrote:

exe626:

zoltanman, when my cousin gets stoned hes like crazy smart. Please tell me how you came up with they can’t remember what they learned when they where high?

I was reading shit about that. Like for instance, you get drunk, and end up stumbling upon an alley, with a barrel full of diamonds. The next morning, you most likely don’t remember anything. Later that night, you’re drunk again, and can remember more than when you were sober.
Same thing can go with weed, but I preferably stay away from it now, because I sing in a band, and it’s ruining my lung’s capacity for air.

Who ever said I’m emo? Emo’s cut themselves, I sir, don’t do that. I guess my opinions piss people off, because they have nothing better to do, than sit on their computer flaming a 15 year old. Lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Drunk under age?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“zoltanman, post:115, topic:148356”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=203452.msg1804503#msg1804503 date=1191662325]
Actually, there are many many many more recreational drug users than there are addicts. Most rec. drug users just hide it from people like you.
[/quote]

I know people who do it, but I don’t hang out with people who do it.[/quote]
You don’t hang out aswell with be that uses alcohol or believes in a different faith then you?
It’s stupid thinking you’re the best and then end up being a normal worker like millions others, even millions of drugs/alcohol users.

I drink regulary (about every weekend). I’m part of the smartest kids, I’m getting to university in 2 years. I know people who uses wheed and they are on the same level as me. I know a lot more people using weed, who ore one level lower, but still the smarter part of civilisation. So don’t say, people who uses anything related to drugs will become fucked ups.
You only see people like Britney, who completly abuses drugs/alcohol and then get a fucked up. But that’s the small part.
In the Netherlands the goverment is discussing about full legalisation of soft drugs. Why? Because they can controll the quality of it. So that people smoke good weed and not some shitty stuff. It’s legal to have / use it already. Everyone is aloud to have 6 weed plants, for personal use. If it was realy as bad as you say, then it wouldn’t be legal.

Read full topic

item.title: Drunk under age?
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

[quote=“zoltanman, post:102, topic:148356”][quote author=lawl link=topic=203452.msg1804454#msg1804454 date=1191660960]
from a completely non biased view, its quite obvious that drugs are way too over dramatized by the government/media. based on facts: weed cant kill you, weed isnt addictive, weed wont make you poor.
[/quote]

Wrong.

One major concern about marijuana is its possible effects on young people as they grow up. Research shows that the earlier people start using drugs, the more likely they are to go on to experiment with other drugs. In addition, when young people start using marijuana regularly, they often lose interest and are not motivated to do their schoolwork. The effects of marijuana can interfere with learning by impairing thinking, reading comprehension, and verbal and mathematical skills. Research shows that students do not remember what they have learned when they are “high”.[/quote]

thats just a statistic. it doesn’t mean you will try other drugs…

edit: oops on the not boze post

Read full topic

item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

To enjoy that activity or music or whatever you base your life upon, of course. For instance, I’ve found I live for two things: fencing and trying to enlighten others. Fencing because it’s one of the funnest things, if not the funnest thing, I’ve ever done, and trying to enlighten others because of the accomplished feeling I get when I see I’ve turned others to my thinking.

item.title: Drunk under age?
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“Silver Lining, post:109, topic:148356”][quote author=zoltanman link=topic=203452.msg1804461#msg1804461 date=1191661130]
Silver, the point of life, is something we will never know. What I do know is, the point of life can be whatever you want it to be.[/quote]Exactly what I was saying. If I didn’t explain it clearly, my post was meant to convey that the point of life is what you live for.[/quote]

But what’s the point of living for it?

That question can go on and on, we could be here for years debating that.

I can see the difference, it’s just my opinion is very strong against any drug use. I’ve lost alot of friends because of them using drugs. That’s why I feel so strongly about it.

item.title: Drunk under age?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“zoltanman, post:107, topic:148356”][quote author=exe626 link=topic=203452.msg1804466#msg1804466 date=1191661371]
zoltanman, when my cousin gets stoned hes like crazy smart. Please tell me how you came up with they can’t remember what they learned when they where high?
[/quote]

The information says it can, doesn’t say it will.[/quote]

Exactly, now we are getting somewhere.

I never denied irresponsible, heavy use of drugs could cause these things.

We are talking here about responsible, recreational drug use.

Can you see the difference? Because if not, this debate is pointless.

item.title: Drunk under age?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

zoltanman:

Research shows that the earlier people start using drugs, the more likely they are to go on to experiment with other drugs.

This statement alone shows me that whatever you quoted was propoganda and not scientific.

Correlation != Causation.

Anyone compiling statistics who ignores that rule can safely be ignored.

item.title: Drunk under age?
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

On another topic

from a completely non biased view, its quite obvious that drugs are way too over dramatized by the government/media. based on facts: weed cant kill you, weed isnt addictive, weed wont make you poor.

Wrong.

One major concern about marijuana is its possible effects on young people as they grow up. Research shows that the earlier people start using drugs, the more likely they are to go on to experiment with other drugs. In addition, when young people start using marijuana regularly, they often lose interest and are not motivated to do their schoolwork. The effects of marijuana can interfere with learning by impairing thinking, reading comprehension, and verbal and mathematical skills. Research shows that students do not remember what they have learned when they are “high”.

Long-term regular users of marijuana may become psychologically dependent. They may have a hard time limiting their use, they may need more of the drug to get the same effect, and they may develop problems with their jobs and personal relationships. The drug can become the most important aspect of their lives.

Silver, the point of life, is something we will never know. What I do know is, the point of life can be whatever you want it to be.

Read full topic

item.title: Drunk under age?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“Fr33b1e, post:98, topic:148356”]When you think about it clearly, there is no point in life at all.[/quote]I’m sorry, I believe the problem is that we didn’t realize you were another idiot with no tangible goal in life. Of course life has a point. To learn, to play, to be satisfied, to influence others, and so many other things can be viewed as the point of life. Life is a wonderful thing, and to say it is pointless is just stupid. Go cut yourself, or whatever you do in your spare time, but stop spewing shit you saw on TV out of your mouth and go do something you enjoy, or even try something new. There’s no point sitting in your chair and trying to sway your e-fellows if you don’t know your own position. Fix yourself, then fix us.

Read full topic

item.title: Drunk under age?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Fr33b1e:

I feel sorry for you. You spend your whole day on MITB, instead of applying for a job. Why? Because 99% of jobs require a drug test, which you would get a big FAIL stamped on your resume.

Actually, the semi-crippling psychological problem I’ve been struggling with for the last year or so plays a much bigger part in that.

I would pass a drug test if I was to take one right now.

Read full topic
